alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 2:06PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.3 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands to farm and pasture lands throughout the Mason Valley-Yerington area. Some low structures adjacent to river begin to flood. Several secondary and some primary roads flood. Exceeds flood peak of June 2017. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:50 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:50 PM PDT Tuesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.4 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 07/01/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 415 PM PDT.
